ygData.subject: Re: Slam vs. Bash
ygData.msgSnippet: Try being a female Dark Elf warrior, im not the only one on MM but I have only seen 2 others, I double both there levels combined :). I have also played a
ygData.messageBody:
Try being a female Dark Elf warrior, im not the only one on MM but I have
only seen 2 others, I double both there levels combined :).

I have also played a female and male erudite paladin.

But yes gnome warriors are rare indeed. I have only ever seen one on MM.

> ----------
> From: Jason Coan[SMTP:COANJ@...]
> Reply To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> Sent: Wednesday, May 19, 1999 11:39 PM
> To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] Slam vs. Bash
>
> From: "Jason Coan" <COANJ@...>
>
> If you really want to be different, try a Gnome warrior :)
>
> >>> "Mifsud, Michael" <Michael.Mifsud@...> 5.18.99 7:52:55 PM >>>
> From: "Mifsud, Michael" <Michael.Mifsud@...>
>
> A good point here Vashi. I also find that the speed of two scims with a
> kick is QUITE effective at interrupting an enemy caster...BUT I dont know
> how that compares to a high bash skill.
>
> Is there a tower shield in the game? i.e. the Roman type shield??
>
> My RL friends and I are planning to switch servers when a new one comes up
> (because I double there levels and they dont seem to be catching up :)
> Ill
> be starting a human warrior on the new server for a few reasons -
>
> 1) There pretty rare compared to the specialist warrior races (Ogres,
> barbs
> and trolls
> 2) +25% xp bonus coupled with the lowest xp table (quick acceleration).
> 3) Human males look TERRIBLE in leather and chain, but look quite
> impressive
> in plate mail.
>
> Anyway, I think a human warrior in full plate with a tower shield will
> look
> quite impressive. What is the weight of a full set of bronze vs. black
> Iron
> vs. normal plate? thanks.
>
> > ----------
> > From: schlaban yocksovik[SMTP:anonymaste@...]
> > Reply To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> > Sent: Tuesday, May 18, 1999 10:30 PM
> > To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> > Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] Slam vs. Bash
> >
> > From: "schlaban yocksovik" <anonymaste@...>
> >
> > hmm waste of time learning bash cus you get dual wield?
> > I have to dissagree with you big time.
> > The sole purpose of a higher level warrior is not being able to
> dualwield
> > and smack the enemy with loads of damage.
> > Thats the casters job, warriors are tanks and should have rockin armor
> and
> > a
> > shield for protection and to bash with to stunn and interupt casters
> IMHO.
> > Sure dualwield is _realy_ good and thats a skill to keep maxed too, it
> > rocks
> > on easier mobs, but when the s#&t hits the fan that bash and shield ac
> > might
> > be the thing saving your teams but.
> >
> > ps
> > I dont want to start a flame war, just my oppinion.
> > ds
> >
> > vashi
> > >From: Kyle Buffington <KBuffington@...>
> > >
> > >Slam is what the larger races get and Bash is what the smaller races
> get
> > >with a shield.
> > >If you are a warrior like me then you are wasting your time with bash
> if
> > >you
> > >are going to dual wield when you hit level 15.
> > >I am not positive if it is a waste of time with a Barbarian.
> > >that is my understanding into bash and slam.
> > >
> > > > -----Original Message-----
> > > > From: Patricia Halas [SMTP:patty_halas@...]
> > > > Sent: Tuesday, May 18, 1999 8:11 AM
> > > > To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> > > > Subject: [warriors_eq] Slam vs. Bash
> > > >
> > > > From: "Patricia Halas" <patty_halas@...>
> > > >
> > > > What is the difference between Slam and Bash? I have been bashing
> > > > everyone
> > > > like crazy trying to get it up to the same level as my kick, and now
> I
> > > > find
> > > > out that I might be wasting my time. I am a Barbarian Princess, so
> > > > slamming
> > > > people around is right in my league, but just what is the
> difference?
